title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 04/27/2022 INC#0089

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0089; 02:00AM; 1500 N Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Klxnrp; #Chinatown; 77 Firefighters took just 29 minutes in defensive operations, to extinguish flames in a vacant 30' x 40' commercial building, the site of a previous blaze. Despite sizeable flames and portions of the structure collapsing into the subfloor during the the well-coordinated firefight, adjacent businesses were protected from harm. Though the building showed evidence of previous unlawful habitation, no persons were discovered, and no injuries have been reported. Firefighters will remain on scene to further search the premises and overhaul smoldering debris. The specific cause of the fire has yet to be determined. ; FS 1; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC11 BC5 CM22 E1 E2 E201 E202 E203 E209 E210 E3 E9 EM1 HR3 RA1 RA3 RA801 RA803 T1 T10 T2 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1345; 06:28PM; 19021 W Miranda St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3kc6hbw; #Tarzana; 26 LAFD Firefighters took just 23 minutes in offensive firefighting operations to access, confine and fully extinguish flames in the attic of both units of a vacant 1,500 square-foot, L-shaped one story residential duplex. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC17 E273 E293 E73 E93 RA73 RA93 T73 T93; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: CONTAINED - Greater Alarm Brush Fire 04/26/2022 INC#0787

item.description: CONTAINED - Greater Alarm Brush Fire; INC#0787; 12:35PM; 12660 W Garber St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LkPIpL; #Pacoima; The first arriving 50 LAFD ground personnel, supported by precise helicopter water drops from LAFD Air Operations, took just 30 minutes to hold the fire to one-quarter (0.25) acre of light brush. Firefighters prevented flames from damaging any residential structures. No injury. No evacuation. Fire cause is under investigation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO2 BC12 BC14 BC15 BP74 CM42 CW3A CW3B E102 E18 E24 E274 E275 E287 E289 E290 E298 E7 E70 E75 E77 E81 E88 E90 E91 EM15 H1 H3 H5 HA1 HA3 HA5 RA91 RA98 RI600 T74 T75 T87 T90 T98 + LACoFD Hand Crew; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#0787; 12:05PM; 12660 W Garber St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LkPIpL; #Pacoima; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to one-half (0.50) acre light brush burning, moving uphill. One or more homes threatened. No evacuation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BC14 BP74 CW3A CW3B E24 E274 E275 E287 E289 E290 E298 E7 E75 E81 E90 E91 EM15 H1 H3 H5 HA1 HA3 HA5 RA91 RA98 T74 T75 T87 T90 T98; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire 04/26/2022 INC#0016

item.description: Knockdown - Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0016; 01:25AM; 1120 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3BLaY3L; #Downtown; 103 LAFD Firefighters assigned in largely defensive operations, took 72 minutes to access, confine and extinguish heavy fire in a 150' x 60' combination one (rear) and two (front) story commercial building, the site of a previous burn. Firefighters prevented the fire from damaging adjacent commercial structures. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM22 E10 E13 E209 E210 E211 E215 E227 E266 E27 E4 E9 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA209 RA810 SQ21 T10 T11 T15 T27 T66 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 13 15; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0016; 12:13AM; 1120 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3BLaY3L; #Downtown; 86 LAFD Firefighters assigned in defensive operations at a 150' x 60' combination one (rear) and two (front) story commercial building, the site of a previous burn. ; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM22 E10 E13 E209 E210 E211 E215 E227 E266 E27 E4 E9 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA209 RA810 SQ21 T10 T11 T15 T27 T66 T9 UR27 UR88; CH9; 13 15; Brian Humphrey

KNOCKDOWN Brush Fire; INC#1180; 04:56PM; 9505 W Hidden Valley Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3k9xwDC; Beverly Crest; KNOCKDOWN: Firefighters contained and extinguished the fire in 48 minutes, holding it to 1/4 acre. No residences were damaged. Firefighters will remain on scene to conduct for about 2 hours to conducted mop up operations and ensure no hot spots remain. Beverley Hills Fire (BHFD) Engine 2 and BC1 are also on scene. There are no injuries reported. The downed powerlines remain an electrical hazard and LA Dept of Water and Power will handle and are the agency for any questions regarding power restoration (it is unknown how many may be affected at this time). No further details. ; FS 108; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; CH5; 17; Margaret Stewart

Traffic; INC#1187; 04:42PM; 1060 S Main St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3LbR5XC; Downtown; A collision (reported to be at the conclusion of a pursuit) occurred with three patients being transported: 2 LAPD officers and 1 civilian (age/gender unknown). None have any life-threatening injuries. Two additional patients (civilians) declined treatment/transport. No LAPD incident number available. The 9-1-1 call was received at 4:12PM. No further details.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E10 E209 EM11 RA10 RA11 RA17 RA20 RA46 RA810; CH4; 14; Margaret Stewart
